bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 24, 1900

div1.p: Lazear writes that Mabel Lazear's doctor will telegraph him when her situation changes.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 24, 1900
div1.p:
I am sorry
you had the trouble
of moving but should
thank you would be
much more comfortable
in the cottage. You
must make the landlady
have what you want
to eat. New Englanders
do not usually know
much about such
things and you have
to tell them. It is
fortunate you have
been at a cool place
during the hot spell.

We felt none of
it here. It has been
cool every evening.
The mails are very
bad here now, These
are only thrice a week
and they are very
careless about getting
letters off. Often letters
mailed twenty-four hours
before a steamer sails
do not reach it in
time.

I am sorry Mabel had
to be in Boston during
the hot weather but it
was best for her to be at the
hospital in good time.

She tells me she has arranged
for the doctor to telegraph
to me when the event occurs.
Have you been able to make every
trips to Boston? Do you like
the climate at Annisquam?

I still hope to get a leave
sometime in October but it
can be only for a short
time. It is possible I may
be ordered to the laboratory
in Washington for a short
time next year when we are
finishing up our work.
